Reviews.Title: Convert
Reviews.Author: Rich Ball
Reviews.Content: I will admit I was a skeptic when I bought this camera.  I have a toddler and a tech-retarded wife, both of whom are responsible for previous spectacular digicam annihilations.  So I turned to the Stylus 790 more out of desperation than anything.Now I admit to being a total convert.  For the price-point, I was just hoping for something that took mediocre pics and wouldn't die in 6 months at the hands of my ruthless gadget assassins.  It, in fact, takes remarkable pictures, comes with a ton of handy features barely noted on Amazon, and really is indestructible.Really.  And by indestructible I mean it has survived being burried at the beach, dropped in the bubble bath, thrown in the toilet (more than once), gone through the dishwasher cycle (don't ask), dropped from our 3-level balcony to the sidewalk below, and having been laundered (washer AND dryer).Plus battery is good for hundreds of shots, the video clips are surprisingly crisp, and I rarely have issues with blurry pictures any more.  Also, Olympus' face-finding technology is pretty amazing stuff.Overall I would highly recommend this camera on its own merits as a great camera.  The fact the it survived my household is the icing on the cake, since (I hope) you won't be nearly as rough in testing it.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Good For What It Is, But...
Reviews.Author: Bruce Motta
Reviews.Content: I have some special requirements for a digital camera, and the Olympus is one of the few that seemed to fit the bill. In particular I needed a camera that had image stabilization and be somewhat weather proof as I use it to take one-handed shots from a moving vehicle. While I am not a photo journalist, I do take a lot of photos for a motorcycle publication and needed something that I could use in less than ideal circumstances.Unfortunately my last camera had no image stabilization, so about 1/3 to 1/2 of all the photos I took came out blurred. But before I could make a decision on a replacement, my old one died. Apparently some road grit had gotten into the lens and one day it refused to extend or retract. Since most of the compact digital cameras on the market have lenses that extend prior to use, it narrowed the field down dramatically. This was the main reason I decided to go with the Olympus.I've had it for a few months now and had occasion to use it for both moving and normal photography (I've posted a few good and bad photos here). I'm not completely sold on it, but to me the pros outweigh the cons so I'm going to keep it. There are however, a few design issues that I find frustrating.The first is the focus time (the time between pushing the shutter button and when the photo is actually taken). With my old compact digital it was almost instantaneous, so "I got what I shot". With the Olympus it takes a second or two, which when shooting moving vehicles (from a moving vehicle) is enough time to allow the subject to change position and now be slightly out of focus. Unfortunately image stabilization will not compensate for that.Another issue is the placement of the flash. On most cameras the flash is on the opposite side from where you hold it (the flash is usually on the left while you hold it on the right). However, on the 790SW the flash is on the same side as the hand grip, which means that if you are not extremely careful your finger will block part of the flash. I have some group photos taken at night where the people on the right side are in darkness while those on the left and in the center are properly lit.But the biggest issue I have is with the battery life. Typically I would get between 300-400 shots from the battery on my old compact digital camera. However, the battery life on the 790SW is amazingly short. My first trip I got only 170 daylight shots before the camera completely shut down. As it was only mid morning and I wouldn't be able to charge the battery until that night, I spent the rest of the day with a useless camera while dozens of great photos got away. Since then I picked up a second battery, but still have to keep an eye on my power consumption so that I don't run out before the end of the day. I thought about buying a third or forth battery, but at that point I would be spending a large chunk of the overall cost of camera just to keep it powered.In short:Pros:Bulletproof (water/dust/freeze/crush/shock proof)Non extending lens will not jam from dirt or dustAuto open/shut metal lens coverImage Stabilization7.1 MegapixelCons:Focus timePlacement of the flashBattery lifeMust remove the battery to charge itWhile the focus lag-time problem might be unique to my work, the flash and battery issues are ones that everyone should consider before buying this camera. If you have unique needs (camera robustness, weather/water proof) then this is one of the few choices on the market and worth the money. However, if you don't need the special abilities this camera has to offer, I think you would be better served looking for something else in this (or even a lower) price range.

Reviews.Title: Great Performance in a small package
Reviews.Author: Rebecca and Brian "R. & B. Palmer"
Reviews.Content: I am a pro photographer, shooting with a Nikon D2Xs.  I was looking for a compact camera for my wife, when I saw this camera in the reviews, it seemed like a good choice.  I did some research and found a SCUBA website that tested it to 64' deep, and although the depth gauge stops at 30 something feet, it performed fine event at over double the rated depth.I was specifically concerned about the contrast these little point and shot cameras have, coming from the world of pro DSLRs... This isn't a $4500 D2Xs, but I was very surprised how good the picture is.  The large screen is very sharp and bright. The integrated lens cover is metal, and seems like it would be sturdy.I would recommend this camera as a high performance compact point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: Orange-ya-gonna read?
Reviews.Author: Waxingellaesque
Reviews.Content: First let me say, while not the highest MP's on the block, the advertized "oopps-proofing" of this camera drew me in. Drops from up to 5 feet can be weathered, its submersible, can operate in temperature conditions to 10 below 0, and the portability are all sure fire winners in our family.  Now onto the software: Can I say WOW?  Very user friendly (as I have YET to crack open the book).  Was able to literally shoot right out of the box, navigate the settings on the camera without issue(still more to learn I am sure, though), and with a simple plug in of the USB, uploading is automatic!  SOOOOO much easier than my first digital camera circa 1994 (yes, you read me right)....AND WORKS SEAMLESSLY WITH VISTA!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Nice editing tools within the software, thus no need to import pics into Photoshop or the like to correct red eye, etc. You can even email right out of the software v. attaching pics of old camera softwares gone-by.  Camera boasts the ability to shoot video as well (although I'd recommend the 2GB card, which likewise allows for tons of still images should you be away on vacation and unable to download/free up space).  Case colors are eye catching too.  All in all, considering the rough-in-tough capabilities (without the tank look of many electronics that are made for active and or clumsy users), the requisite/acceptable number of mega pixels (note I did not say stellar, just acceptable), the software (both in and out of the camera) and the large viewing screen (considering the overall size of the camera to begin with), this was a good buy for our family's needs.

Reviews.Title: Tonka Tough digital camera...
Reviews.Author: Auliya "An Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: ProsHe's a tough little guy, he's not going to break if you bump him or spill on himHe's an attractive cameraHe's small enough to go with you anywhereHe's easy to hold and handle, he comes with a safety strap tooHe's easy to use, no steep learning curve, just point and shootHe's plug-n-play style with Windows XP, no software install requiredConsHis battery doesn't recharge unless you pop it physically out of the camera and pop it into a separate charging trayAdditional ThoughtsIt's a good-looking, tough, small camera -- perhaps more bulky than the pictures you see on the web reveal, but still small and comfortable in the hand. I didn't need the manual to start using it right away. I am enjoying new freedom from paranoia! I know that if I knock this camera around a bit it's not going to die on me. The toughness of the camera makes me brave about it, and that's why I bought it. As for picture quality, features, battery life... they all seem very good to me, pretty standard for your daily point-n-shoot. I've have the camera for a few weeks now and I use it constantly. Again, the big selling point is its hardiness. I am not shy about keeping it with me in a bag or pocket because it can handle being bounced around a little. I haven't found a thing about this little guy I don't like! :-)

Reviews.Title: Leaky
Reviews.Author: C. Floyd "floydiak"
Reviews.Content: The 790SW I bought died almost immediately upon contact with the ocean.  Water got into not only the battery compartment, but also seeped in under the viewing screen...all this from being no more than two feet underwater for about 20 minutes  We didn't even have a chance to apply the rather elaborate post-immersion rinsing and cleaning instructions in the owners manual.  In my admittedly limited experience, this camera is just not as rugged or waterproof as other comparable models I've used for several years (e.g., the Pentax Optio waterproofs)

Reviews.Title: Not the best but sure is fun
Reviews.Author: R. Seifried
Reviews.Content: I read several mediocre reviews of this camera (not so hot quality, etc etc) but in the end I bought in anyway soley for the fun of taking it underwater (we were heading to Hawaii for snorkeling.)  I have to say, I don't really care that it doesn't take the greatest pics, it is super fun to take it into the water, and some of our favorite action shots are from the beach or underwater.  lots of blurry pics underwater, so you need to take a lot to get some that are clear.  also, it was almost impossible to see the screen underwater, between the angle of the light and screen.  Some land pics were blurry too,so seems the camera struggles to focus sometimes.  I would not buy this as your sole camera, but we already have a good, bigger digital that we worry about more, and we didn't want to leave it on the beach, get it salty, etc. but we used the good camera when we wanted quality shots. The Olympus was a second camera that we didn't have to worry about.  in short, this camera was just what I expected, but I am really glad we bought it and we will continue to have fun with it in rainy, cold, salty, wet, etc places.

Reviews.Title: Small is beautuful
Reviews.Author: L. A. Smith "Artists, writer, keeper of cats"
Reviews.Content: I'm still figuring out all the bells and whistles, but so far, I'm mightily pleased with this camera. The built-in user guide makes it easy to figure out which setting to use for certain shots. The stabilization feature is great for low-light and fast-action shots. Overall, I think Olympus has developed a splendid and intuitive user interface. Most of all, I love how compact and attractive it is. ai can carry it in just about any pocket or purse and be ready to take all those shots I missed because I didn't have a (good, bulky) camera with me.

Reviews.Title: Happy I moved to Olympus from Canon (YUCK!)
Reviews.Author: Me.TheUltimateChallenge Fitness "Lazy Newyorican"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. I used to own a Canon SD600 which was great for what we needed. But just like my 2 Canons before that, it stopped working within a year of purchase. Everyone had told me that Canon was the best but after 3 strikes I was sick of paying the money. And when I sent the Camera back to Canon for repair (under warranty mind you) they told me it would cost $107 to fix because I dropped it. I have never dropped that camera, EVER. Then they had the nerve to offer me the AD900 at a discounted price. This camera has a Titanium shell and got super poor reviews for being fragile, of all things. I'm done with Canon. After a few weeks of research, I settled on this camera.The Olympus 790SW is awesome. Great pics, awesome built in features. We make calendars right on the camera and send them out as post cards every month. It's water proof and we've taken underwater pics in the pool with it. It's light so it feels cheap but clearly is not. The video is only 25 seconds at high resolution but on the 2nd to highest setting it'll go on forever. We haven't been able to test the image stabilization because the camera just refuses to take a picture out of focus or blurred. I haven;t experienced any of the artifacts at high resolution that others have complained about. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a point and shoot. It truly is the only point and shoot I have ever encountered (more so than the Canon(s) I have had). Don't be scared off by the orange color. There are others available but the orange color looks distinct and cool. The Sound quality is great too and the flash is bright.  Still not convinced? Go to your local Best Buy or Circuit City. Even best buy told me that if you don't want a Canon, this is the best Camera to get and the toughest. Plus, you can play with it there too. Again, don't let it's weight throw you off (it's very light). Check it out at any decent electronics store but buy it at Amazon to get the best price.Hope you get one. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: S. Schreyer "portalwiz"
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 790SW 7.1MP Waterproof Digital Camera with Dual Image Stabilized 3x Optical Zoom (Black)I took this camera to Antarctica. It functioned excellently in high winds and cold temperatures. Indoor photos are good, except for fast motion in low light (e.g., a tango show in a darkened theater). The video is marginal due to poor image quality.I use a Canon S2 for my serious photography, but it is not always with me due to its size.  The Olympus 790WS camera is always in my pocket or backpack, ready to record the unexpected Kodak moment.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Rabey "brabey"
Reviews.Content: We previously had a Canon Elph SD 110, which we loved until it was dropped in the water on a kayak outing. The Stylus 790SW takes better pictures especially with the anti shake mode and no flash (I hate flash wash out.)I wish it wasnt made in China, but its quality is good and 95% of the other cameras on the market are as well. This camera is very easy to use, with intuitive menus and functions.

Reviews.Title: Image Quality Just Isn't There...
Reviews.Author: David Tansey
Reviews.Content: I might be spoiled by my Canon Rebel XT, but I have been very unimpressed with the image quality of the 790SW. I bought it because I was traveling to a tropical climate that had some high-crime areas. I figured having something that could stand inclement weather and stay hidden in my pocket would be good to have.I've taken several dozen photos, with as many of the settings as I could play with, both preset and custom, and have been unimpressed. The photos actually look grainy, as odd as that sounds for a digital camera. The colors are not especially accurate. Also, it requires flash for just about everything.If you need shock proof and water proof, then get this. If not, there must be better cameras. Unless I can find a way to get reasonable shots, I'm probably going to sell mine after this trip and get something else.P.S. My standards might be too high; I haven't really seen non-SLR photos for a long time. Also, although I understand why they have their special memory card, I would have preferred getting a camera with a more standard card.

Reviews.Title: Great Outdoors Camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Whitney
Reviews.Content: I took this camera snorkeling in Hawaii and came back with some great underwater photos. Even if you have no plans to go anywhere near a body of water in the next 10 years, however, the Olympus Stylus 790SW is still a great camera for the outdoors. First, it's waterproof as the snorkeling photos will attest. If you've ever taken pictures in the rain, you can appreciate how nice a waterproof camera must be. Second, it's freeze proof. If you've ever taken your camera out on a cold winter's day, and wondered if the thing would even turn on, you can appreciate how nice a freeze proof camera must be. Finally, it's shock proof and crush proof. If you've ever scrambled over a chunk of granite bigger than your couch when the camera in your jacket pocket slams into the rock--yeah you get the idea. It is very small and light, and fits very comfortably into a pocket. The battery life is decent. With 7.1 megapixels and 3x optical zoom, even the above water photos look great. With the only downsides being that it uses the not-so-common xD picture cards and the backlight on the LCD screen could be a bit brighter (especially underwater), it's an easy camera to recommend.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Joel Williams
Reviews.Content: Our family has lost 2 cameras due to water (I dropped one in the ocean while taking a picture after snorkling) and impact (my daughter tossed her backpack to the floor, forgetting that she had the camera in it). We were ready for something that can withstand a "little" abuse. This camera has been great so far. We have good Christmas and holiday pics. There are lots of great settings to pick from, such as portrait, landscape, night, sports, indoor, candle, self-portrait, available light, sunset, fireworks, cuisine, behind glass, documents, auction, shoot and select, beach and snow, and several underwater modes. I really like the "guide" setting that helps you pick zoom effects, exposure effects, color effects, etc. The only drawback to this camera (like most other point and shoot cameras we've tried) is the lag time between pressing the button, and the time it takes to record the shot. It compensates somewhat, but if this is really important to you, then go with a high dollar SLR like the Canon Rebel or Nikon F40 or F50, or something similar. We are completely satisfied with what we have and as the old saying goes, you get what you pay for. There are lots of cheaper cameras, but none can withstand the abuse and the elements, while taking good pics. Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: M. Cao "cavalero"
Reviews.Content: This is my third camera in 6 months; I tried Lumix and Canon before. Either the quality was not acceptable (Lumix) or the camera drowned by accident in a drink (Canon) - the Stylus 790 has so far exceeded my expectations with great picture quality and the peace of mind it can take a drop or a plunge in the water and keep on ticking. Highly Recommended (so far).

Reviews.Title: Great camera for backpacking trips
Reviews.Author: A. Cullen
Reviews.Content: Robust camera with great battery life. Only negative is there is a small wait time for the camera to focus before you take pictures, resulting in some blurry images.

Reviews.Title: Other reviews sold me!!
Reviews.Author: Judy A. Mijares
Reviews.Content: When trying to decide what camera would be best for my teenager, the reviews here sold me on the Olympus Stylus 790sw!!  Being waterproof, drop proof from less than 5 feet and the image stabilizer, made this camera perfect for my daughter and she loves it.  Small, compact and easy to use!  thanks amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great all-purpose digital
Reviews.Author: MLB
Reviews.Content: We have a digital SLR for quality pics but wanted something small that travels well and is easy to use. After tons of research and reading reviews we picked this one. It has exceeded our expectations. This camera is extremely durable, portable, and offers a good quality picture in most settings. We usually turn the flash off indoors because it is too bright. Other than that it's a great piece with an easy to use interface.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof as advertised - Tried two different cameras
Reviews.Author: B. Mac
Reviews.Content: I would return this camera if I could.  I bought the camera mainly for the waterproof feature.  I wanted something that could replace the disposable waterproof cameras I buy occaionally.  I should have saved my money and stuck with the disposables.  I took this camera snorkelling and it was under only a few feet of water.  After drying it off when I had finished I found water had leaked in to both the USB and battery/memory card ports.  I returned the camera to Olympus under the warrenty and they sent me a new camera.  Unfortunately that one leaked too afer submerging it in the sink.  So Olympus suggested I send it back.  At least that time they payed the shipping.  But the camera still leaked after they returned it. Olympus didn't find anything wrong with it but couldn't tell me what they had tried with the camera when I called customer service.  So they suggested I send back it again. I had to pay for the shipping a second time.  Again the camera leaked when they returned it to me and they insist there is nothing wrong with the camera when they try it out.  It still leaks under a few inches of water.  Unfortunately I can't physically take the camera somewhere to show someone the water damage.  Olympus has suggested that I return the camera to them for a fourth time but since they have previously insisted that there is nothing wrong with it, I see no point.  So I guess I'm stuck with a waterproof camera that leaks.

Reviews.Title: Horrible pictures
Reviews.Author: T. West "stream3200"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes mostly blurry pictures. Most of our vacation pictures are ruined and now I'm stuck with this camera after buying the 2GB picture card and an extra battery. I went to Bestbuy to ask if there was anything I was doing wrong in regards to taking blurry pictures. The on site expert told us this is the worst camera he's seen and would never recommend it to anyone. He said they have more returns on that camera than anything else.  I'm normally not a negative person but please do yourself a favor and don't buy this camera. I'm going to contact Olympus directly and see if they can exchange it for a different model.

Reviews.Title: So far so Good... Great Camera
Reviews.Author: L Garcia "ELEL"
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all.. Better than the Previous Sony cybershot I have which is pretty much on the same price. Tested in Water with no Problem, very durable, and good quality pix. Only the video sound very hard to hear, but once transfered to PC... sound alright, just average.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Po "apo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for its waterproof feature. It turns out to be a great everyday camera as well. 10ft is deep enough for all of my activities. The image stabilizer works well.

Reviews.Title: Terriffic Camera!
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Rudberg "Stephen Rudberg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Olympus 790SW about a month ago and was quite skeptical that it could do all the things Olympus claimed it could do -- especially be submerged in water. My trip to Big Island, Hawaii this past two weeks was the perfect testing ground to see if the camera could deliver what it promises. Well, I am pleased to say that it exceeded my expectations. I took pictures and video snorkelling in Kealakeuka Bay and I was amazed at how the camera performed. My pictures came out pretty good under water but what was really cool was the video I was able to take. That came out even better! Once I got home and downloaded the pictures and video, I was slightly disappointed with the picture quality. Images were on the soft side with touches of red eye and some colors looked a bit washed out but overall the camera is excellent for what it claims it can do. Also great about this camera is the fact that it has many pre-settings for specific scenes but you have to spend a little time playing with the camera in order to adjust and know when to use each specific setting. Another disappointment is the battery life. Yes, as others have claimed, the battery life for one battery last perhaps no more than an hour. So if you know you plan on taking lots of shots during a day, then get yourself an extra battery. I plan to!Otherwise  great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera, waterproof worth it!
Reviews.Author: Andres I. Rubinstein "Arub"
Reviews.Content: i will never buy a product that i have to take care of it!!!!!with this camera there is no worries, you can wash it, crash it, dump it, try to scrash it, NO PROBLEM!!!i had a party last week and the camera get all dirty with food, i just take it down the tap in the kitchen sink, dry it with a towel and continue shooting.With a 2 gb card you can take in the best quality about 520 pics, the battery last like an hour (i bought two more)BOTTOM LINE: if you need a NO WORRIES camera that takes good pictures (no SRL quality)  go for it.The only con is the lag between pictures with flash, it takes a few seconds to reload.

Reviews.Title: ruined vacation
Reviews.Author: Henry Highton "Trey Highton"
Reviews.Content: this camera broke on the second day of a three week vacation in central america.  i had it in the pocket of my boardshorts as i paddled across a lake in nicaragua and it turned out not to be waterproof at all.  water leaked into the camera and fogged over the lens, so although it still functioned technically, you couldn't see anything through the viewfinder at all.  very disappointed in this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Don't leave home without it...
Reviews.Author: Fred Showker "DTG Magazine"
Reviews.Content: After destroying four digital cameras, our quest for a "lifestyle" oriented camera took us to this 7.1-megapixel Olympus.Thank you Olympus for finally discovering that today's digital cameras don't sit at home! The 790SW is a home-run for today's abusive use. 7.1MP waterproof design makes it ideal for field use, and the Dual Image Stabilized 3x Optical Zoom takes spectacular detail for photo-quality 15 x 20-inch prints. Lens to picture quality is nearly as good as our Canon studio camera! (Which I dearly love and wouldn't give up for anything!)While the big disappointment is the lack of a view finder, the 2.5-inch LCD screen does offer brightness settings for use even in bright ambient light. Face Detection technology and image stabilization are proven in stressful, action situations.It is waterproof (down to 10 feet), freeze-proof, drop-proof and crush-proof -- and you feel immediately confident when you pick it up  -- no thin plastic or delecate parts. The lens does not extend and is protected behind both a clear shield and an inner sliding metal cover.Unfortunately video capture at 640 x 480 is seriously limited -- only 20 seconds on a 1-Gig card, but you can shoot long takes at 320 x 240. The video/audio quality is very good.  We used it immediately on both PC and  Mac without complaint -- and without any software installation or instruction.  (It does NOT come with a memory card and we recommend the fastest quality 2 to 4 GIG card available!)This is one tough puppy you can confidently take along on any adventure from the kid's backyard birthday party to the reefs or the rain forest,  land-rover safari. This unit is our official Florida coast, sport-cruiser raft-up  camera, where we've ruined two previous digital cameras!  Just be sure to use a floatation wrist strap!FredDTG Magazine

Reviews.Title: so far so good and as expected
Reviews.Author: S. Nadda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I needed something I could take to the beach and outdoors and not worry about it getting wet or some sand on it.  I will probably never take it underwater or dunk it.  I am worried that many people seem to have had flooding problems with this camera even though the manufacturer guarantees it and is specific about checking the seals and gaskets.  However, it is not worth a guarantee of a manufacturer repair when your vacation and pictures just got ruined.  So I'll stick to the above water waterproof claim.As far as pictures, it takes good pictures but not the best.  My Panasonic cameras and my Canon are far better.  The camera features are easy to learn and use, although I didn't like the owner's manual.  Even so, the features and menu options are sometimes cumbersome or not laid out logically.  I also am a little annoyed with the digital zoom settings.  I bought this camera because it claimed a 15x digital zoom and I need that.  However, this digital zoom is the type where you have to reduce the megapixel setting to about 3MP and then it enlarges the center of the picture while degrading the quality.  There is a smart zoom seting but that only gets you about a 10x magnification or less it seems.  So, if you need long zoom in a compact, this one is not it.  However there are not any waterproof cameras that offer that either.  Since I will have another zoom camera with me, i will not deduct too many points for this feature.  Face recognition works well.  Other special features seem to be good but somewhat cumbersome...Most of the time i don't have the luxury to fiddle with settings and features when my 3 year old is running around and I am trying to get a picture.  Startup time is fast, shot to shot is OK, focus time is pretty good.The video feature is decent, but again, not as good as other brands like SONY or PANA.  You have to make sure the camera is focused before you start video, otherwise it gets blurry for the whole movie...annoying.  The zoom doesn't seem to work well in video mode either.  Otherwise, the quality is ok and there are 2 different quality settings 30fps or 10 fps.Conclusion:  For waterproof cameras in this category and price, this one is great deal. It's good quality, portable, fast, feature loaded and stylish. This is why I git it 4 stars. I don't like the Xd Card system, so be ready to invest if your new to Olympus.  If waterproof, shockproof and freezeproof means nothing to you, then spend your money on a Canon, SONY or PANASONIC and you'll be much better off.

Reviews.Title: Everything I Wanted
Reviews.Author: V. R. Corliss
Reviews.Content: Compact, waterproof, I can shake like crazy and get clear night pictures. I love it! The battery life is long.

Reviews.Title: Mini magic
Reviews.Author: W. Muller III "Uncle Bill"
Reviews.Content: I am in love. In the past, I have always favored the traditional SLR type camera with the big lens on the front and the peek through a hole viewfinder. I even bought a digital version of said SLR when they first came out. I thought all the guys running around looking at mini TV's on the back of match boxes were crazy, or at least not very good photographers. Well, I've changed my mind.A few weeks ago I decided to go visit my brother in Seattle (I live in North Carolina)and I didn't want to carry my big camera. My birthday was coming, so I dropped some hints (Gee, that Olympus Stylus 790SW seems like a nice little camera) of the vague type. My older daughter bit and bought me one in a kit. I took it to the West Coast, used it at the Boeing Museum and the Seattle Art Museum as well as on a ferry at night. I was sold. This camera has adjustments for everything from fireworks to underwater - yes, underwater - closeups. You can shoot fast action almost as fast as film and the pictures turnout. Night shots look great. It has a "face finder" feature to help the photographer and it was easy to figure out. I'm 65 and us old dogs don't do well with new trcks, but this was an easy study.One little "negative" comment: If you are an extreme telephoto nut, this is not your camera. It only goes to 3x, but for the money, it isn't that bad.I'd buy one as a gift for someone I loved.Olympus Stylus 790SW 7.1MP Waterproof Digital Camera with Dual Image Stabilized 3x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: All-terrain camera suits my lifestyle
Reviews.Author: Lilredrasta
Reviews.Content: I needed a tough, waterproof camera for work and play.  I have previously carried around a point-and-shoot in a zip-lock bag which was marginally effective and a big pain to deploy.  I love the sub-compact, shirt-pocket size of the 790SW and all of the capabilities in terms of water/dust/shockproofing.  I replaced the wrist strap with a breakaway neck lanyard (Catstrap made by EK Accessories) and that's how I usually carry it when I am wading with my fly rod, up to my waist in muddy water in a duck blind or paddling my kayak.  I love the internal zoom--the camera fires up instantly--I hit the "on" button and by the time I have a picture framed it is ready, flash is charged, etc.  7.1 resolution is more than sufficient for my use.  Would love to have a bit more zoom but 3X seems to be pretty standard so I can live with it.  Only other issue is the memory card--would prefer the use of an SD instead of the proprietary XD (the XD does not fit some card readers) but otherwise, the camera has thus far exceeded my expectations and the Amazon price even beat most listings on Ebay.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, versatile P&S; Camera that can go underwater!
Reviews.Author: E. Su "drerwinsu"
Reviews.Content: I almost bought an Olympus 770 earlier this summer.  At first glance the 790 seems to be a step backwards because it is only rated to 3m depth while the 770 is rated to 10m.  However, further inspection shows why the 790 has distinctive merits that make it a winner.Let's face it, 95% of most of the shots that we'll take with a camera will be on terra firma.  Therefore a camera should be as versatile and have the conveniences of the latest point and shoot models.  It should be small and thin with a decent sized LCD display.  The 790 offers these features with the added bonus of being waterproof.The 790 fires up quickly and takes pictures quickly.  You can find the exact times from other review sites.  It also offers face recognition autofocus ability.  I was looking for this feature because many of the shots that we typically take are portraits, etc. to remember vacations, trips, etc.  The 790 also offers an impressive array of settings that cover many, many different types of photographs.  The menus are easy and intuitive to use.  It also offers decent movie capability.The added bonus of being totally submersible makes the 790 an excellent point and shoot camera.  I used the camera on a recent Disney cruise through the Eastern Caribbean and the 790 worked very well in all aspects of the trip.  I could use it for typical touristy shots and then plunge it in the surf while playing with the kids.  Images taken during a snorkeling trip were rather nice.  The water was a little turbulent but the 790 still took decent pics.  In the pool with clearer water the pictures were very clear.  It was nice not having to worry about water, sand or hard knocks with this camera.  I have used underwater cases for other digital and film cameras.  There is a great advantage not having to use a case because you can see the screen much easier on the 790.  The screen on a camera inside a case is almost impossible to see underwater when you are wearing a dive mask.As stated before the 770 is rated to 10m depth.  But as a hobbyist snorkeler I rarely go deeper than the 3 m that the 790 is rated.  Other reviewers have stated that they have taken the 790 to deeper depths.  I have a trip to Maui coming up in March (poor me) and will possibly take the 790 to a little deeper depths.The waterproof capability of the 790 also can lead to some amusing pranks.  I had told my middle daughter about this feature but did not tell my oldest daughter.  I had my middle daughter take a picture in the surf of my oldest daughter and myself and she took a "fall" and dropped the camera into the water.  Needless to say I was "upset" and she was "mortified" that she dropped it.  The oldest daughter freaked out until we told her.  We had a good laugh.  When we go to Maui we will do the same thing to some friends when we go to the pool.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 790
Reviews.Author: Mitch Silver
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  We took excellent underwater pics on our cruise in Mexico.  Very easy to use and compact.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jamie N. Bauer "jn"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for my boyfriend who loves to snowboard. We took it on our trip to Colorado and it took great pictures without having to worry about dropping it in the snow or falling on it while in his pocket. The durability of the camera gives you so much more freedom! Take the pictures where you want to take them! It is so much fun!

Reviews.Title: Yes, it really works underwater
Reviews.Author: S.F.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to upgrade from my 3.2 Canon which I love.  I wanted to avoid having to buy any underwater disposable cameras for un upcoming trip to Cozumel.  Camera worked flawlessly. Pros include ease of use, large viewing screen and ability to take it underwater, including underwater video that can't be done on the disposables.  Negatives would be that you have the same issues underwater as in bright light above water, i.e. trouble seeing the screen.  Without a viewfinder it is sometimes difficult to feel confident that you are capturing your subject. All in all, I'm happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Review Depends on Customer Service and Warranty
Reviews.Author: S. Burns
Reviews.Content: Used this camera 4 times on a Jamaican trip.  On a snorkeling trip, once in water screen turned black.  Got back on boat and found battery cover and additional cover closed; however, water was obviously in the camera.  Talked to Olympus Customer Service, who was very pleasant on the phone, and have to send the camera in to have a look.  Not certain what will happen now.  When it worked, it took great pics.  Doesn't have much of a zoom, but okay for price.  Hope to have good experience with Customer Service/Warranty Dept and have the camera back soon.

Reviews.Title: Yes
Reviews.Author: J. Neill "Dr. Joe"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift for Christmas.  It is remarkable small which is the best part.  I put it in a coat pocket and lost it.  I could not feel it wearing the coat.  The down side is the small size too.  I took a few pictures of my fingers.  I wanted a camera to fit in the pocket on my PFD while paddling a canoe.  I tie it to my PFD and can deploy it with one hand.  The wildlife pictures in wet conditions is where this excels.  It is hard to see the screen in bright sun with out a viewfinder but I expected this for the compactness.  It is a point and shoot with limited over rides. I still am learning it but am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: zorta "zorta"
Reviews.Content: A great xmas gift that  brought a lot of happiness! I was debating between this camera and the pentax and am so glad that I went with olympus it is user friendly, takes amazing pictures and is compatable with all of our electronic gear.

Reviews.Title: Too many flaws for $250. It has/had potiential.
Reviews.Author: TechPhile
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera upon its release in 2007 and now after almost a year, I have some opinions. I'll try to keep it simple.XD card format: Going the way of the dinosaur. Finding decent priced cards is hard. Also, the XD format tops out at 2gb. Unaaceptable. This in itself is a deal breaker. I think any new camera purchase from 2008 on should be SD/SDHC compatible as it is seemingly the industry standard as well as the only mini/micro class card media to go up to 16gb.Video recording Limitations: Another deal breaker. The VGA resolution of recording has a 10 sec limit. There is a firmware update that allows unlimited (card limit) recording but Olympus only released it for the 1030sw and 850sw. Even then, the limit is 4gb but that is not even a factor as the 790 has no update available. The only plus in video recording is the AVI format. I appreciate this as I work mainly with AVI's with my Pocket PC's and Creative Zen Vision M Media player.Low light captures: Indoor photos with low ambient are very poor. I have tried many different settings and even adjusted WB & ISO but to no avail. the flash either washes out the focal point or over compensates if using the shadow adjust "feature".Delay time in capturing images: If using the scene modes setting in the wheel selector, every time you turn on the camera you have to manually select a scene. You cant take a picture unless you manually chose a scene. So time from power up to scene select to auto focus to capture can range up to 5 sec if using scene select. When using image stabilization, the capture time is also delayed. noticibaly much that I have missed many special moments when my son (2yo) was smiling doing something cute. Even a shutter button hard press (bypassing the half press autofocus) did not actually bypass anything. It was still delayed.Size: It is in the compact catagory competing with most sony dsc & T models and the Lumix line. Although for a water resistant it is the smallest that I know of beside the canons.Outdoor shots: This is where the camera has its best captures. Greens and blues are true and auto focus seems fast when well lit and using the correct ISO/Scene select. Assuming that the person who wants a all-weather camera is active and needs a camera that can capture an image quickly, this camera should suffice for that situation.Durability/H20 resisance: I have not tried this under water. It did get a little rain on it and no problems there. I had dropped the camera from about 4 ft to tile floor. It survived. I did the same drop by accident on my old Sony T-20 and it seperated into 2 pieces.Favorites setting: This is where the manual is wrong. I dont care what it says, you cannot retrieve a photo once it is marked as favorite. The manual will say that you can move a photo back but I tried with no avail. In other words, unless you only plan to have a photo sit in hte cameras memory and not print, copy or transfer to your computer then great. If you have not copied it to your computer or printed it before you mark it as a favorite you are out of luck with that and will only be able to view it on the LCD or in a slideshow on TV via AV cable. Once marked as a favorite, it is gone from the XDcard and embedded in the cameras memory with no way to transfer it off or back to the card. Ridiculous. That's no way to treat a favorite anything right?I really wanted to like this camera due to the 7mp, weather resistance, "video recording", size and the fact that I spent about $350 with the extra batteries and silicone case. But I will be selling this camera due to the above issues and cannot recommend it with good conscience to anyone. Unless you can get this camera for under $150 and plan to use it as a outdoor/beach only camera then go for it. It should meet and exceed your expectations. Another situation where the 790sw would be ok in, is if it's for a child, like a young child. This camera may be good for them as it should withstand most minor bumps a kid would throw at it... and the occasional drop in the toilet at summer camp.BTW, the firmware update that was offered to the other Olympus cameras allows you to use one of their XD card adapters to use a micro SD. So you will need to buy another item. Yet another issue is thta this SD to XD adapter is not available for sale, it comes packaged with the new Olympus cameras but for the 790 people we are out of luck. So basically we need the Firmware 1.1 release AND the adapter release. I have emailed Olympus support requesting the Firmware 1.1 update for the 790sw. I highly doubt that they will oblige but if they do I will happily edit this review. Until then I am boxing this up for eBay.

Reviews.Title: It is not waterproof
Reviews.Author: DANIEL AREAS BRITO "Jack BSB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in october/2007 and to my surprise, when I took it to the beech at the end of the year, It got soaked with water when I was diving in a depth no deeper than 15 inches. I sent it to dealer to fix it in the warranty, and they told me they wouldn't fix it because of bad use of the equipment. I'm very disapointed with olympus. This is false advertising!!

Reviews.Title: garbage
Reviews.Author: Louise Kanaan
Reviews.Content: This camera failed underwater the first time I tried to use it. I was merely snorkeling on the surface, not free diving, and I only got two shots off before it jammed. After it dried it seemed ok and I never used it underwater again. Had it less than 2 years and just used it recently and it is malfuntioning again. Says the card cover is open when it clearly is not. Very frustrating when you are on vacation and can't take pictures because your camera is broken...again. Maybe I got a lemon, but of course it is out of warranty now and I either have to go through the headache (and expense) of getting it repaired or buy something else. Would certainly NOT buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater shots, lacking in optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Sirka
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous to purchase this camera due to some reviewers who had obviously purchased faulty (leaky) cameras.I am happy to say that this camera took fabulous underwater shots on my recent cruise to the Bahamas.  The shots are clear and perfectly focused.I knew going in that the optical zoom was not great, but I bought it specifically for the water resistance and am not disappointed.Another plus is that you can use it straight out of the box - charge up the battery, purchase a card and start shooting.  No need to read the manual first.You do, however, need to submerge the camera in fresh water after taking underwater photos.  As I was at the beach, I simply poured drinking water over the camera and set it in the shade to dry.  I submerged it in fresh water later back on the ship.Simple to use, great underwater shots, great in motion shots, good price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active college student
Reviews.Author: M. ROBERTS
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter. After she had gone through several other cameras that she had broken, I decided that she needed a camera that would hold up to her active lifestyle. This one was the only one that I found at a reasonable price that was shock resistant and waterproof. For anyone that loves the beach and loves to snow ski this is the perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff
Reviews.Author: Richard Stevens
Reviews.Content: The camera is working great.  The blue actually comes out to be more purple then it looks. It would be nice if the package came with a memory card, the XD is not as readily available as the SD. But overall we are excited to use the camera around the water and not have to worry about ruining the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater shots, but poor quality otherwise
Reviews.Author: Alexander Shenkin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I work in tropical areas, and having a camera put up with an inundation occasionally is a handy feature.  However, I now would love to return this one and get a camera that takes good quality pictures.  This one returns consistently disappointing results - the picture quality is just flat-out poor.  It never seems to quite get in focus, and the pictures are always soft and somewhat blurry.  I had a canon sd700 (which took a dip in a lake - whoops), and the pics it produced were phenomenal, especially compared with this.Instead of being glad to have a camera that will put up with a beating, I'm bummed that it will do so, because it means i'll be stuck with bad pictures until this camera breaks, which is going to be a long time.  Maybe I'll sell it on ebay.Another frustration with this camera is that Olympus, in their mythic wisdom, decided to make their USB connection proprietary.  That is - you cannot use a normal USB-b cable with this to download your pictures.  You have to use Olympus' cable.  Which means you have to drag around another cable wherever you go.  Annoying, to say the least.  Infuriating would not be an exaggeration.I'm giving this 2 stars instead of 1 because it might actually be useful for folks who snorkel, etc.

Reviews.Title: Hardy little camera
Reviews.Author: MollyP "mollyp"
Reviews.Content: Let me start of by saying that I dropped this camera DOWN A WATERFALL the first time I used it. I bought the camera for when I went waterfall rappelling in Costa Rica and it fell out of my pocket on the way down. Bounced off the cliff edges and survived a beating in the pool at the bottom. Incredible. That being said, the pictures are so-so at best (even before I dropped it :) Color quality is only OK, and pictures are kind of grainy, so it's great for places where you want something rugged, but maybe don't care so much about clarity.

Reviews.Title: EZ  To Use So Far
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Clark
Reviews.Content: I think I love it. So far so good. Reading the book directions was a dull drag but using the directions that are built into the camera are simple and logical.I'm getting the natural indoor light pictures that I have dreamed of getting. I don't like the look of flash photos except for the famous photographer Weegee's work. You can set the camera in a simple way for the lighting conditions you normally may encouner( even flouresent lights of 3 different types). No complcated f stop settings to learn.I've taken night photos that work without a flash- using existing light.I haven't tried it underwater yet but I'm going kayaking in Florida next week so I'll find out. I got the flotation strap that looks huge in the Amazon Photos but it's quite small-I'm trusting that it will live up to the hype.I love the irredesent lime green of my camera. More when I return.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: S. Tarzwell "Steph"
Reviews.Content: I found this just before leaving for a cruise.  It's taken several droppings, it's been in salt water for about 10 hrs total and it's still taking great pictures.  The quality is far better than any "water camera" you pick up at wal-mart for $10.  I love that it's digital and so you can keep re-taking if needed.With the right expectations this is a great camera.  I wanted something small enough for a pocket, a good size screen on the back, take memory cards, a decent zoom, and easy to use.  This camera delivers on all those.  It dose have good battery life, nice land or under water pictures, nice color selections, and good buttons.A few small short comings, it takes special batteries (AAAs would be nice, but not a big deal)and all the options are great but can be a little annoying sorting through.If you want something simple and are reasonable about what your getting in such a small water tight package then you'll be happy.  If your wanting something similar specs without the water proof/shock for the price you can do a lot better.I would buy this camera again exactly the same if this one dies, it's allowed me great freedom while at sea and also out mudding in the Jeep cause I can just wash it off, no problem if it's dropped either.  You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: It's not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Denis Page
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera to use in my trips. The huge problem is: There is no manual settings in this camera. You have to use or the auto shoot (terrible in many situations) or scene mode.Scene mode works well enough in some scenarios, but it's terrible with low light.If you're planning to buy a camera to use only in outside locations, it's a good camera (including pools, beach, etc).

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Its such an easy camera to use and takes great pictures.  Loooove the sand waterproof feature!!

Reviews.Title: Great for the novice/intermediate photographer
Reviews.Author: Kristian Stav
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera i have ever owned and i think it's great!  In comparison to cameras that my mates own/have owned the olympus 790SW's waterproof functionality and shock resistance make it a great camera for those on the go and living active lifestyles.  The image quality is more than sufficient for anyone who just wants good quality pictures to upload on to your computer or print off as memories and this is also aided by the various shoot modes the camera provides.

Reviews.Title: the best camera EVER
Reviews.Author: Emily D
Reviews.Content: Before getting this camera I had the Stylus 770, until I dropped it and a taxi drove over it.  Even after being run over by a car, the only thing structurally wrong with it was a cracked screen, however something was obviously wrong on the inside as it wasn't staying on for more than a few seconds, so I started looking for a new camera.  I was going to buy the 770 again, but opted for the newer 790 version.  I love this camera.  Just like the 770, it takes great pictures in every situation I have used it in, including underwater. Since getting it, 3 of my friends have purchased it as well because they liked mine so much.  This is a really sturdy camera with great functions and easy to use. You can definitely drop it, sit on it, dunk it into a glass full of rum and coke, take it into the ocean and cover it in sand and it keeps on taking great photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: StEt0417
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because we needed a waterproof camera. We are always in the water and at the beach. So the sand and water has runied all my other cameras but this camera has held up great and works wonderful in those condition's!! It takes great picture'sI couldnt be happier with this camera and im glad that I got it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lane Weast
Reviews.Content: The Olympus Stylus 790SW 7.1MP is in fact Water proof AND shock proof.I nervously tested it in the swimming pool and it worked great.The casing seems to be aluminum which crumpled a little on the corner when it was accidentally dropped from a high table onto concrete. It's still water proof and works fabulously. It's rated for 10 foot of water. Had I realized, I would have gone for the slightly more expensive model which is good for over 30 feet of water.Notes:It doesn't float so find a way to keep it from sinking past it's limitations.There is a two second delay between button press and actual snapshot, (maybe this can be changed in a setting) but the pictures come out really really nice. Excellent focal processor.The zoom really is a 3x Lense Zoom.The flash is Super Bright, one of the brightest I've seen on a small camera.Get the Spare battery it's worth the few extra dollars.The battery does NOT change from a cable connection, only while in a charger.I love this camera, It's a perfect size, rugged, and I don't have to be concerned about rain or spilled drinks. It's well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Bomb Proof
Reviews.Author: F. Klemm "Kayak Camper"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  I do a lot of backpacking and kayak trips and wanted something that could take a little bit of abuse.  I didn't want something that is bulky either.  This camera seemed like a good choice.  The pictures are sharp and clear.  I wouldn't intentionally use it underwater without the accessory water proof case though.You can get extra batteries on ebay for about $5 bucks delivered.  I also bought a 2 gig memory chip.I'm happy so far.  Amazon delivered the product in a timely manner.  Now, get yourself one.Best

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Durable and easily fits in your pocket. Has a good range of shooting modes, but the quality of the images isn't as good as a Canon. Overall if you just want a point and shoot camera that's durable and affordable this works well.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera...
Reviews.Author: B. Olson
Reviews.Content: ...even though it didn't work in salt water! I purchased it to go to Costa Rica and the second time it was taken in the ocean (only about a foot under) water leaked into the battery department and the battery/memory card/screen got wet. The camera stopped functioning at this point. Besides that, though, it takes great pics. The different settings (cuisine, landscapes, video, etc.) are great and very easy to use and it's size/weight make it easy to take everywhere. I plan on exchanging it for a new one since once Olympus fixes it there's only a 6 month warranty vs. the full year it starts out with.

Reviews.Title: sturdy, great  second camera
Reviews.Author: Brina C. Bolanz "bcb"
Reviews.Content: I had the 720 SW (was stolen) and now just bought the 790 SW.  What with camping, beach, and a 3-yr-old we can be a bit tough on cameras, and this is wonderful to not worry at all about dirt or water or dropping.  You can buy better cameras for the price, but none that will take the punishment this one does.  And the 790 is an improvement:  one of the annoyances I had with the 720 was corrected(they added a dial to quickly get to the camcorder and other useful modes that were previously only accessible by scrolling through menus.  Also added is a "guide" mode that easily helps you fix composition problems with one touch).  They also made the buttons easier to press by touch, making them either bigger or edges more pronounced.  I still find the camera a bit slow, but you won't find better with any other of the (few) waterproof cameras available.I find the photo colors a bit pale and too cool, but these are easily fixed afterward.I'm not a fan of point-and-shoots coming without a viewfinder, and this one is no exception. But the 790 has a light that can be turned on to fascilitate framing a pic in the dark, which I haven't tried much yet but must be an improvement.I plan to buy a DLSR very soon, so I will have that for speed and exceptional photos, and this one for everything else -- worry-free!

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, best part is that it's waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Thurman "IT Geek"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my girlfriend for a snowboarding trip we were going on. It takes "ok" pictures. The auto focus seems to be working overtime, so I changed it from face detection for her to spot detection, that way it only focuses when you press the shutter halfway. After using the camera for a day, she switched back to her 5 megapixel Kodak V530. The color quality compared to the V530 is terrible on the automatic settings. I just bought the camera because she wanted it, she's the one who takes pictures and sells them.I might consider this camera to someone who is going on a trip like ours where the camera could get wet or dropped, but only because it can handle it, yet I personally would not recommend this camera to my family or friends.

Reviews.Title: Nice package but very poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Srgsx
Reviews.Content: I have used a Pentax Optio for two years and thought the 790Sw looked like a nice upgrade. However after a weekend using the camera the deal breaker to me is that almost every picture turned out grainy and or out of focus. I will go back to using the Pentax for now. I sure wish Cannon would come out with a water/shock proof camera !

Reviews.Title: Good Stylish Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Osherow
Reviews.Content: Okay, I love the orange color of my camera and it looks highly stylish. The camera is really small so it fits easily into my pocket so I can carry it around everywhere. The fact that the camera is waterproof and shock proof is amazing and most unique. I used the camera in the hot tub and snow skiing and didn't even worry about the camera getting wet or broken. As for the photos, they are crisp and the color and quality seem more than good enough for most uses. Also, the setting and options on the camera are very diverse and allow for almost any photographic situation you will encounter. Excellent and very cool camera!

Reviews.Title: Get the Pentax
Reviews.Author: W. N. "Will-N-LA"
Reviews.Content: Based on a recommendation I did a search on Amazon for "Pentax waterproof camera," Every page that comes up is polluted with this Olympus model--including the pages for the Pentax models.This camera is a drag, the images are of much lower quality than I expected, the camera controls seem counter intuitive. I still haven't found how to shoot multiple panoramic images. The Olympus software is a complete headache to use on my Mac.I should add that I am a professional photographer, I've been using Nikon,  etc.. equipment for 25+ years. Digital for 10. I shoot professionally the Nikon and have no problems with it's more varied features. I've also had a Canon G5 digital that was joy to use. This is not some pro nitpicking. I simply wanted a camera I could take on my kayak. My friend with the best kayak photos recommended Pentax Optio, I set out to buy a Pentax, but the cluttered and annoying Amazon page design misdirected away from what I wanted to this second rate camera. (How many times really do we need to be offered their credit card?)The Pentax shoots 30 fps while this only does 15fps. Yesterday I wanted to document a sea lion with a fishing net wrapped around it's neck. I'm glad I shot multiple images because the Olympus underexposed them all and I was only able to use one image. Recommendation: My sea kayaking friends all agree: Get the Pentax Optio. (If you're not going to get it wet....maybe something else).

Reviews.Title: Hard use
Reviews.Author: waylon meurs
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 5 years including 15 months in iraq.  They are dust and waterproof, i have never had a problem with this at all.  Only weakness is rechargable batteries instead of AAs.

Reviews.Title: Convenient, but very POOR quality for night pictures :(
Reviews.Author: texan
Reviews.Content: I love the size and portability of this camera.  I have had it 3-4 years and it's pretty reliable and takes GREAT pictures for the MOST part.I find though, the nighttime quality is very POOR :(I took it into best buy to see if they could correct the settings or adjust the resolution, but it never fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: I've spent 27 months with this camera...
Reviews.Author: NatoNatoBooks "-Nate"
Reviews.Content: and this camera is my buddy... I have the lime version and we've been almost everywhere together since December 2007.  Just last week, I took it with me to a rock concert and got some great photos (more on that a little later).  Even though I'm not much of a drinker since leaving college, I still refer to this as my "drunk proof" camera, because I think it would be absolutely perfect for a bar-hopping college student... you don't have to worry too much about getting it wet or dropping it.  I don't worry about it when I leave it out in my truck in freezing temperatures.  I've had it out taking pictures when it's really dusty and the wind is blowing dirt around, etc and I just don't worry about it at all.The one time I did worry was when we were in Maui last May (2009) and my wife (who bought it for me in 2007) wanted to take it with us snorkeling.  Well, what the heck right?  The first time we took it out, it performed beautifully in the shallow water... no problems at all!  Later that day, however, we tried using it in the hotel swimming pool.  No problems with the few pictures we took, but soon after that, the camera ceased working.  I don't know if it had something to do with the chlorine in the pool or what.  No worries - aloha spirit and all that, so I just left it open, took out the battery and card and let it all dry out.  It wasn't soaked or anything, but I had the feeling there was some moisture inside.  This was unfortunate because while I had my Canon PowerShot with me, I wasn't about to take that down by the water and the cheapo disposable camera we bought on the beach for body boarding pictures ended up getting ruined before we could develop them.  A day or two later, the battery still wouldn't work... the light on the charger would just flash like I was crazy for trying.  Well, I was a boyscout back in the day, so I had a brand new extra battery with me.  After charging that battery (and again, the camera had sat with the door open for a day or two to dry out completely), everything worked just fine... the XD card was fine - just the battery went bad.  I've been using the camera ever since.  Would I be worried to take it in an ocean or lake with me again?  Yes, I would.  Honestly, I'd probably just buy a high-quality disposable camera.  I can tell you that I would NOT take it in a swimming pool again, that's for sure!Now that the water issue is out of the way, I wanted to address photo quality.  Have I got some grainy pictures with this camera?  Yes, I have.  Did I try to change the setting to get better pictures?  You bet!  I feel that you definitely sacrifice a little bit of photo quality with this camera in exchange for some very cool features.  However, if you're willing to play with it a little bit and learn some of the settings, you can usually get it figured out and take some really good pictures.  For instance, it's very easy and fast to turn the flash on and off (just push right on the control pad) or push the flower button on the left side if you're shooting stuff super close.  The top button on the control pad for exposure is awesome... it will show you 4 different possibilities at a time, then press left to see darker settings or right to make it brighter... that's a BIG help and is super fast and easy to do!  Also, when I was taking pictures at the concert last week for instance, it was low light (at times) and I was not about to use a flash, so I turned the knob to the little shaky hand (between the SCN and the picture of the camera (auto setting)) and it did great!  The local newspaper even put some of the pictures I took on their website!  Of course you can also play around with the knob on the SCN setting... Sport is another favorite setting of mine when I'm trying to take pictures of moving people/objects.  Available Light is another one I use fairly often.  WHEN SHOOTING OUTDOORS (especially in bright sun), turn the knob to GUIDE and press down twice (3 - Shooting into backlight), then press OK (1 - Activate Shadow Adj.) and that helps TREMENDOUSLY!  Without that setting, I would be in trouble.  I use it almost 100% of the time when I'm outside and the sun is out (sometimes even when it's cloudy and kinda bright).  On a side note, the the movie mode works just find and is an additional nice feature this camera offers (I believe it shoots in WAV or some type of Microsoft compatible format - it's not the QuickTime kind).  I hope that helps a little bit!In short, this camera is not perfect, but it's still pretty awesome.  You don't need to bother buying a case for this camera!  The battery seems to last forever, which is I take for granted sometimes.  I do try to charge it up before going out if I know I'm going to be using it a lot (note: it does take a few hours to charge completely).  My 2 GB XD card is almost full right now and there are 1800 high-resolution pictures AND some long videos on there!  The main reason I can't give this camera 5 stars is because, unfortunately, I would agree that it is questionable under water.  Others might not give it 5 stars because of picture quality.  It might not take the very best pictures, but I have taken a LOT of really good ones!  I will admit that there was a lady next to me at the concert last week with a Canon PowerShot SD940IS (the red one) and she was taking, for the most part, a lot more quality pictures than I was.  However, if your buddy spilled some beer on that camera at the bar or if you got bumped and dropped it or if it fell out of your pocket in the car and you left it out in the cold or if you took pictures in the pouring rain or maybe a dust storm... would the Canon hold up like this Olympus Stylus?  I doubt it!  This Olympus is one TOUGH camera!  Take it for what it is.  I might buy a Canon for a little bit better quality pictures, but this Olympus will always be my go-to tough guy back-up if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: Happy a year after
Reviews.Author: GX
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a little more than a year and can't say how happy I am with its durability. I do a lot of kayaking, crew and water sports and it is such a comfort to know that this can be brought into the boat without any worries. The batter is still strong and the casing has lasted very well despite frequent use. Would recommend Olympus to others.The one main downside is that the onscreen controls are not as intuitive in my opinion as a Canon.

Reviews.Title: It's Ok but not great
Reviews.Author: Joel R. Barham "Rhinostarman"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for vacations on the water and the ability to take shots in rainy weather. It is indeed waterproof and durable, however the shutter lag makes it very frustrating when photographing children. I have a lot of just missed shots because of the delay.Once taken, the colors seem very vibrant. Once again it is Ok but not great.

Reviews.Title: Almost the perfect camera for the job
Reviews.Author: Marc S. Gibian "Enjoying the outdoor world"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are die-hard skiers and we want to photograph the beauty around us while we ski as well as each other. We've tried our other digital camera, a Fuju that we have loved, and our small digital video camera. Both freeze. And when I say freeze, I mean after only moments in the air on a mountain at 32 degrees... or even higher ... they freeze, even after carrying them in an inner pocket to keep them warm. SO, I was hunting for a camera specifically for outdoor photography in the winter on the slopes.The Olympus Stylus 790SW is almost perfect for the job. First, when outfitted with an in-specification memory card and a fully charged battery, it works great in the cold! We demonstrated this many times this past winter, on mountains that were cold... 20 degrees at noon cold. Second, while we hadn't specifically been looking for it, the camera is shock-resistant. The specs say it will resist the shock of being dropped from a specific height. Well, we haven't dropped it. But we HAVE fallen while its in that inner pocket. I don't believe either of us has fallen directly on the camera, but I certainly worry a great deal less than I have with our other cameras during our winter photography attempts. Finally, it is waterproof to a certain depth in a body of water. This is perfect for those days when the snow is getting under the coat, or even on those occasional rain bursts. No fear of trashing the camera.The only negative is the lack of a viewfinder. Only the large LCD provide feedback as to what the camera is pointing at. Indoors this is fine. Outdoors, in the bright with white snow reflecting light right at you, this makes it at times impossible to see any hint of what the camera is capturing. Add to this the effect of the polarized lense in most goggles, and its just plain hard to see the LCD while on the slopes. The good news in all of this is that I've taken many a blind photo only to find, when reviewing it that evening, that I got exactly what I was looking for... the only real challenge is holding the camera level.The bottom line: This is almost the perfect camera to take to the ski slopes, and it would be perfect with a viewfinder that allowed you to see what you are capturing even in the brightest light conditions.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For :)
Reviews.Author: Serene L. Lusano "serene"
Reviews.Content: It's a handy little point and shoot, but my main reason for buying it was underwater capabilities.Pros:* underwater photography and video! AWESOME!* big huge lcd screen* multiple shooting modes* compact, light, cheapCons:* the menus are so "user friendly" it's almost confusing and childish. If you've NEVER used a camera before, I'm sure it'd be helpful, but for me it's too much extra junk to sift through.* unnecessary "favorites" and "shakey" option on mode wheel (should be embedded as a menu option or playback option)* alot of menu sifting to adjust white balance and other photo settings.* TERRIBLE microphone/sound capture. I hope mine is not defective, because it is really bad. I have a  2 year old 6 megapixel Sony CyberShot thats sound quality is 10 times better. I would advise you not to capture any video where sound is an important factor.

Reviews.Title: Is useful despite drawbacks
Reviews.Author: W. Meyer "quarkbuster"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use while backpacking and canoeing. I was attracted to the waterproof and shockproof features, and it is indeed waterproof (I haven't dropped it yet, so I don't know about the shockproof part). The picture quality is good, but not outstanding, and the various shooting modes are very useful when I remember to use them. It has some serious drawbacks, though. The battery life is poor, so a week-long trip would require at least two extra fully charged batteries. The LCD display is barely visible in bright sunlight and there is no optical viewfinder as an alternative. Finally, like all cameras this size, it's easy to hold it crooked, shake it while taking the picture, or get a finger in front of the lens. I don't regret buying it and I'll use it a lot, but I wish it didn't have these drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: Photo quality decent, underwater feature --> Amazing
Reviews.Author: B_Dog "Dan"
Reviews.Content: So the LCD screen got really scratched up the first time I used it (went tubing down a river so it's mostly my fault).  It has shown to be very shock and water-proof.  It is really tough to figure out how to take black and white shots.

Reviews.Title: Neat camera
Reviews.Author: J. Black
Reviews.Content: Performs as advertized. Photo management program very nice as well. Size takes alittle getting use to, but picture quality is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus
Reviews.Author: Paul Kruse "trout fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Great photo quality for a point and shoot. Use it in the outdoors mostly on fishing trips or nature hikes. Use it to shoot underwater 30 second video's of fish that are caught and released. Holds up very well in underwater situations. Well put together camera!

Reviews.Title: A Waterproof Digital Camera?
Reviews.Author: Edward Sweetser "Sweet doctor"
Reviews.Content: I needed the waterproof feature for my daughter who is a white water river raft guide in Colorado.  This camera fills this need very well.  The camera is easy to use and the pictures are excellent, even during the rapids sections of the river due to the image stabilization feature.  She is very pleased with this camera in every way.

Reviews.Title: BY far the best camera
Reviews.Author: oh hey
Reviews.Content: In the past two years, ive owned a canon powershot, and a kodak easyshare camera. This Olympus is definatly the most tolerant camera ive had. I bought it mainly for the underwater capability and its definitly exeeded my expectations. For me, photos taken underwater have come out extremely clear, and theyre really fun. I took it with me to florida, and most of the time i had it, it was underwater, and nothing has happened to damage it in any way. It continues to take clear, and impressive photos outside and under water, and i definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a small compact camera that is especially durable when it comes to almost anything.

Reviews.Title: Great product, but...
Reviews.Author: Thomas Maplewood
Reviews.Content: If anyone is planning to get this, there is a VERY IMPORTANT detail that you should know.Olympus recently released a camera nearly identical to this one (Called the Olympus Stylus 850sw), except it has a few other good features and 8 mega pixels, rather than 7.1.And the best thing is that they have the same suggested retail price ($299)So, it's a great camera, but get the 850sw.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: William H Jamison
Reviews.Content: I just picked up one of these for $225 yesterday along with a Kodak 2Gb Type H memory card.  After reading reviews I was worried about picture quality & the card write speed, but I am completely satisfied by both. I had been using a 3.0Mp Nikon camera for home and 6.0 Mp Panasonic for work.  Obviously this camera takes better pics than the Nikon, and I would say the pics are comparable to the Panasonic (which is good enough for me).  I also wanted something for snowboarding that could take snow, wind, and rain as well as take continuous shots of my buddies dropping cliffs or hitting jumps.  Based on reviews of the XD card format I was worried about continuous shooting.  My buddy has an Olympus Stylus 820 with a 2Gb M type card that takes several seconds to write photos onto the card.  Luckily, for bursts and video, the claims that the H type card is 2-3 times faster are true (for my setup anyway).  I am able to take an UNLIMITED amount of continuous shots.  Additionally, I can capture about 30 min of standard quality video.  I'm a picky consumer, and kept my receipts in case I wanted to return it.  For this combo however I am fully satisfied with my purchase.  I have yet to test the water/shock proof features, but according to reviews that shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof, shockproof, idiotproof
Reviews.Author: Travis Murphy
Reviews.Content: While I knew there were trade-offs to this camera, namely slightly less megapixels, a weaker zoom (the biggest trade-off), and less bells and whistles than similarly priced camera's, to me the shock/water/sand-proof nature of the camera far outweighs any drawbacks.I got to experience this first hand on the camera's first major test - a two week spring break that involved everything from skiing to camping. This camera was dropped off a ski lift into the snow below and still kept going (and the black color made it simple to find the thing!). It survived a dunk in the hot tub as well as a dusty campsite. All the while I could relax a little because I knew this camera was tough.I'm not a shutterbug and wont pretend to know if the color balance is good or if the noise levels are unacceptable, but I know I have plenty of great pics of my trip. Like any camera, not every picture comes out right, but I got to know the setting buttons and menus which I think are well laid out for quick adjustments on the fly, and this problem disappeared. The camera itself is quite sleek-looking and is thin enough for most pockets. Another plus is it seemed to have a quick startup time for unexpected action shots, as opposed to my old camera whose lens had to extend and withdraw each time, which became agonizing when a good shot passed you by.In summary, if you foresee abuse, accidents, and general mishaps happening to your camera (within reason, of course) this is the one for you. If you'd rather not worry about your camera's health on your travels, this is the one for you. If you none of this matters to you, yeah, perhaps look at your other options first. But being free from worry is well worth the trade-offs in my book.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading very good reviews.  Although while waiting for my camera to arrive i found a negative review and began to worry.  This person said it is an awful camera that takes blurry pictures.  Been there done that and I didn't want to do it again.
